intro.description: Regular patterns are different from SQL patterns. For example, if you search strings starting with 'S', the regular pattern is 'S.*', not 'S%'. Please refer to the documentation of your Database Management System for more details.

item.title: set regex pattern information and content
item.description: This step opens the Regex pattern creation wizard. You can right click on the "Libraries->Patterns->Regex" folder or click the link below. This wizard helps you to fill the Regex pattern metadata (name, purpose, description and expression). At the end it opens an editor in which you can define the settings of the pattern.
